alert.note: Alert for Southeast Prince William Sound (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 08 at 10:34PM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM AKDT FRIDAY FOR THE CORDOVA AREA... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Including the following area, Cordova and areas along the Copper River Highway. * WHEN...Until 430 PM AKDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1029 PM AKDT, Widespread moderate to heavy rain over the Cordova area Thursday evening is causing rapid water level increases on area streams. Flooding is being reported along Power Creek. Eyak Lake levels have risen 3 feet since Thursday afternoon and will rise overnight likely reaching flood stage Friday morning. - Water levels are rising rapidly in small streams across the Cordova area. Flooding is being reported. An additional 2 to 4 inches of rain through midday Friday will cause widespread flooding of low lying areas. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
